body.p:
To his Excellency James F Robinson
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned, Petitioners to your Excellency, respectfully represent that Stephen Forley was at the August Term 1857. of the Fayette Court, tried and convicted, on circumstantial evidence, of enticing away and running off negroes from their owners in Fayette County, Ky.

His term of punishment was ten years imprisonment in the State Penitentiary, which will expire August 29th 1867. He has already suffered imprisonment for the period of nearly five and a half years, during which time he has conducted himself in a becoming manner.
He is now in bad health and further imprisonment will undoubtedly imperil his life.
We therefore, humbly petition and beg for the Executive clemency on his behalf, that he be discharged from the Penitentiary.

J. M. Lancaster.
Chas OHara
Nelson Alley
P. Joyce
Jas S Sneed
H. Hardee
Jas P. O'Hara
L. Tobin
Pat. U. Major
James Shannon
I have been informed the Petitioner is in very bad health.

Geo A Robertson
D, M, Bowers

Pettn for pardon of Stephen Foley
No good ground for Pardon
